contents.item: Play around. Dive into absurdity and write. Take chances. You will succeed if you are fearless of failure.
contents.owner: Natalie Goldberg, Writing Down the Bones: Freeing the Writer Within

contents.item: It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation.
Kites rise highest against the wind, not with it.

When you show yourself to the world and display your talents, you naturally stir all kinds of resentment, envy, and other manifestations of insecurity... you cannot spend your life worrying about the petty feelings of others
contents.owner: Robert Greene, The 48 Laws of Power

contents.item: Judge your success by what you had to give up in order to get it.
In order to succeed, your desire for success should be greater than your fear of failure.
Success is a state of mind. If you want success, start thinking of yourself as a success.

The good news is that the moment you decide that what you know is more important than what you have been taught to believe, you will have shifted gears in your quest for abundance. Success comes from within, not from without.
Eighty percent of success is showing up.
I have learned that success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles which he has overcome while trying to succeed.
contents.owner: Booker T. Washington, Up From Slavery: An Autobiography

contents.item: Keep your friends for friendship, but work with the skilled and competent
contents.owner: Robert Greene, The 48 Laws of Power

contents.item: There are many aspects to success; material wealth is only one component. ...But success also includes good health, energy and enthusiasm for life, fulfilling relationships, creative freedom, emotional and psychological stability, a sense of well-being, and peace of mind.
To be independent of public opinion is the first formal condition of achieving anything great.
Success is...knowing your purpose in life,growing to reach your maximum potential, andsowing seeds that benefit others.
The test of success is not what you do when you are on top. Success is how high you bounce when you hit the bottom.
Missing a train is only painful if you run after it! Likewise, not matching the idea of success others expect from you is only painful if that’s what you are seeking.
contents.owner: Nassim Nicholas Taleb, The Black Swan: The Impact of the Highly Improbable

contents.item: I do not like to repeat successes I like to go on to other things.
There are no secrets to success: don’t waste time looking for them. Success is the result of perfection, hard work, learning from failure, loyalty to those for whom you work, and persistence.
To succeed in the world it is not enough to be stupid - one must also be polite.
The whole secret of a successful life is to find out what is one's destiny to do, and then do it.
